block-definition.s: get features of sentences %'sentences' $nl then do with result %'process result'
block-definition.comment: Passes a list of lists of 512 features of input 'sentences' to 'process result'.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 512 features for each sentence.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Sets the pen color to one of 100 preselected colors, like a box of 100 crayons. The colors have names that are meant to be evocative. They are organized in families, more or less corresponding to spectral (rainbow) colors; the input slot has a two-level menu in which you can hover over a family name to see the colors of that family, each including a crayon number and an RGB value. See Appendix A of the Snap! Reference Manual for more details.

input.options: grays={ 0 black #000000=0 1 gray7 #121212=1 2 gray14 #242424=2 3 gray21 #363636=3 4 gray28 #484848=4 5 gray36 #5c5c5c=5 6 gray43 #6d6d6d=6 7 gray50 #7f7f7f=7 8 gray57 #919191=8 9 gray64 #a3a3a3=9 10 gray71 #b5b5b5=10 11 gray78 #c8c8c8=11 12 gray85 #dadada=12 13 gray92 #ececec=13 14 white #ffffff=14 } pinks={ 15 deep pink #ff1493=15 16 hot pink #ff69b4=16 17 bright pink #ff007f=17 18 raspberry #e30b5d=18 19 amaranth #e52b50=19 } reds={ 20 red #ff0000=20 21 burgundy #900020=21 22 cherry #990000=22 23 dark candy apple red #a40000=23 24 sanguine #c00000=24 25 maroon #800000=25 26 #fee33e=58 59 rubber duck #fbe108=59 } greens={ 60 lime #00ff00=60 61 apple green #8db600=61 62 Operators #62c213=62 63 forest green #228b22=63 64 green #008000=64 65 dark green #006400=65 66 dark block-definition.comment: Don't ask. Only for internal use by the SET PEN block.
Creates a bunch of global variables. For internal use by Color library.

custom-block.s: ✐ set pen to fair HSL vector %s %l
✐ set pen to fair HSV vector %s %l

custom-block.comment: SUBSET throws here if it handles a unique match

block-definition.s: ✐ set pen to HSL saturation %'value' %'more value'
✐ set pen to HSL vector %'value' %'more value'
✐ set pen to fair HSL vector %'value' %'more'
✐ set pen to fair HSV vector %'value' %'more'

block-definition.comment: Reports the part of the first string up to the first instance of the second string inside it. If the second string isn't found, reports the entire first string.

custom-block.s: substring of %txt from position %n to position %n inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the character position (starting from 1) of the beginning of the first input string inside the second input string. If it's not found, reports 0.
If input is TRUE, comparisons made by functions in the string library will be case-independent (so "FOO" = "foo"). This is the default. If input is FALSE, comparisons will be exact.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera comparações ignorando distinção minúsculas/maiúsculas para _

block-definition.s: substring of %'str' from position %'start' to position %'end' inclusive
block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input (string) starting at the position given by the second input (counting from 1, like LETTER n OF) and ending at the position given by the third input (also counting from 1). If the third input is empty, reports the portion from the first position to the end of the string. If a position number is negative, counts from the end backward, so -1 is the last character, -2 is the next to last, etc.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ entre as posições _ e _ , inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the input text with lower case letters instead of capital letters in the input. Uses the user's locale's rules for case conversion.

This block creates new variables on the selected scope: global (for all sprites), sprite (for this sprite only) or script (only for that blocks stack) with the names given (in 'names' list). If there is already a variable with that name in that scope, it does nothing: no errors and no overwrites.
block-definition.translations: pt:cria as variáveis _ _ ca:crea les _ variables _ es:crear las _ variables _ de:erstellen _ var _

block-definition.comment: This block reports "true" if there is a variable with this given name (input slot) in that context. It can be a global, sprite or script variable. Otherwise it reports "false".
block-definition.translations: pt:a variável _ existe ca:existeix la variable _ ? es:existe la variable _ ? de:existiert var _ ?

block-definition.s: Add example(s) %'data' $nl with label %'label' to KNN model named %'classifier' $nl and if there is an error %'error handler'
block-definition.comment: Associates a list of numbers with a label. Optionally accepts a list of lists. Will create the KNN model if need be. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-nearest_neighbors_algorithm

block-definition.s: Classify %'data' using KNN model named %'model name' with top k %'top k' $nl do with response %'response handler' $nl else do with error %'error handler'
block-definition.comment: After adding examples to a KNN model predict the odds of which label fits a new list of numbers. The top k nearest neighbors to the data vote for their label. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-nearest_neighbors_algorithm
No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.

block-definition.s: Open this in a new tab
Classify %'data' with top k %'top k' using KNN model named %'model name'

custom-block.s: Classify %l using KNN model named %txt with top k %n %br do with response %cmdRing %br else do with error %cmdRing

custom-block.comment: Make sure we are in edit mode.

custom-block.s: Open this in a new tab

scripts.comment: An example is just a list of numbers. It could be any data you like. Here they are the sentence embeddings of two classes of sentences. See https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-5.html#sentence-embeddings

custom-block.s: Add example(s) %l %br with label %txt to KNN model named %txt %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.l: I like chocolate broccoli. I'm proud of my pet cloud. I wish I had a rainbow in my pocket. I'm glad I'm losing money. I think the earth is a cube.

custom-block.s: Add example(s) %l %br with label %txt to KNN model named %txt %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.l: It is sad when someone is hurt. You should not eat junk food. Lightning can be dangerous. Don't walk on thin ice. I like learning new things.

scripts.comment: Here we ask the model for the nearest 3 neighbors to a new sentence embedding. Each neighbor gets a 1/3rd vote for how to label this sentence.

custom-block.s: Classify %l with top k %n using KNN model named %txt
custom-block.comment: Try different sentences and top k.
